metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: CSS Great Font Pairings
Great font pairings are essential to great design.
content.html: Great font pairings are essential to great design.

content.text: Font Pairing Rules
Here are some basic rules to create great font pairings:
content.html: Here are some basic rules to create great font pairings:

content.text: 1. Complement
It is always safe to find font pairings that complement one another.
content.html: It is always safe to find font pairings that complement one another.

content.text: A great font combination should harmonize, without being too similar or too different.
content.html: A great font combination should harmonize, without being too similar or too different.

content.text: 2. Use Font Superfamilies
A font superfamily is a set of fonts designed to work well together. So, using different fonts within the same superfamily is safe.
content.html: A font superfamily is a set of fonts designed to work well together. So, using different fonts within the same superfamily is safe.

content.text: For example, the Lucida superfamily contains the following fonts: Lucida Sans, Lucida Serif, Lucida Typewriter Sans, Lucida Typewriter Serif and Lucida Math.
content.html: For example, the Lucida superfamily contains the following fonts: Lucida Sans, Lucida Serif, Lucida Typewriter Sans, Lucida Typewriter Serif and Lucida Math.

content.text: 3. Contrast is King
Two fonts that are too similar will often conflict. However, contrasts, done the right way, brings out the best in each font.
content.html: Two fonts that are too similar will often conflict. However, contrasts, done the right way, brings out the best in each font.

content.text: Example: Combining serif with sans serif is a well known combination.
content.html: Example: Combining serif with sans serif is a well known combination.

content.text: A strong superfamily includes both serif and sans serif variations of the same font (e.g. Lucida and Lucida Sans).
content.html: A strong superfamily includes both serif and sans serif variations of the same font (e.g. Lucida and Lucida Sans).

content.text: 4. Choose Only One Boss
One font should be the boss. This establishes a hierarchy for the fonts on your page. This can be achieved by varying the size, weight and color.
content.html: One font should be the boss. This establishes a hierarchy for the fonts on your page. This can be achieved by varying the size, weight and color.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
background-color: black;  font-family: Verdana, 
  sans-serif;  font-size: 16px;  color: gray;

font-family: Georgia, serif;  font-size: 60px;  
  color: white;

syntax_highlighting.text:
background-color: black;  font-family: Verdana, 
  sans-serif;  font-size: 16px;  color: gray;

font-family: Georgia, serif;  font-size: 60px;  
  color: white;

content.code_html:
body {
  background-color: black;
  font-family: Verdana, sans-serif;
  font-size: 16px;
  color: gray;
}

h1 {
  font-family: Georgia, serif;
  font-size: 60px;
  color: white;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
background-color: black;  font-family: Verdana, 
  sans-serif;  font-size: 16px;  color: gray;

font-family: Georgia, serif;  font-size: 60px;  
  color: white;

content.text: Below, we have shown some popular font pairings that will suit many brands and contexts.
content.html: Below, we have shown some popular font pairings that will suit many brands and contexts.

content.text: Georgia and Verdana
Georgia and Verdana is a classic combination. It also sticks to the web safe font standards:
content.html: Georgia and Verdana is a classic combination. It also sticks to the web safe font standards:

content.code_html:
Beautiful Norway

Norway has a total area of 385,252 square kilometers and a population of 5,438,657 (December 2020). Norway is bordered by Sweden, Finland and Russia to the north-east, and the Skagerrak to the south, with Denmark on the other side.

Norway has beautiful mountains, glaciers and stunning fjords. Oslo, the capital, is a city of green spaces and museums. Bergen, with colorful wooden houses, is the starting point for cruises to the dramatic Sognefjord. Norway is also known for fishing, hiking and skiing.

content.text: Helvetica and Garamond
Helvetica and Garamond is another classic combination that uses web safe fonts:
content.html: Helvetica and Garamond is another classic combination that uses web safe fonts:

content.text: Popular Google Font Pairings
If you do not want to use standard fonts in HTML, you can use Google Fonts.
content.html: If you do not want to use standard fonts in HTML, you can use Google Fonts.

content.text: Google Fonts are free to use, and have more than 1000 fonts to choose from.
content.html: Google Fonts are free to use, and have more than 1000 fonts to choose from.

content.text: Below are some popular Google Web Font Pairings.
content.html: Below are some popular Google Web Font Pairings.
